etymologies: Old English wǣp(e)n, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wapen and German Waffe

definitions: a thing designed or used for inflicting bodily harm or physical damage
shortDefinitions: thing designed or used for inflicting bodily harm or physical damage

definitions: a means of gaining an advantage or defending oneself in a conflict or contest

examples.text: resignation threats had long been a weapon in his armory

shortDefinitions: means of gaining advantage or defending oneself in conflict or contest
